comments.name: John D. Rockefeller
comments.comment: CARNEGIE. I JUST FOUND THE BEST WAY TO GET RICH BRO. HEAR ME OUT, WE DON'T PAY OUR EMPLOYEES, AND WE POCKET ALL THE PROFIT. WE GET THIS BAG üí∞

replies.name: Jane Adams
replies.comment: Forget about not paying your employees... You are abusing children in a dangerous workplace that isn't even safe for adults, let alone children.

comments.name: Andrew Carnegie
comments.comment: I'm sorry, I can't hear you over the sound of my steel mills üëÇüèæüîä

replies.name: Upton Sinclair
replies.comment: You are the embodiment of a hypocrite. You claim to be a philanthropist, but you are exploiting your workers and paying them low wages. You are not the good person you claim to be.

comments.name: John D. Rockefeller
comments.comment: Just donated $80+ million to the University of Chicago and founded the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. #ChangingLives

replies.name: New York Times
replies.comment: How about the many illegal and shady business tactics that you have done? You used vertical and horizontal integration and lowball pricepoints to drive out your competitors. You are not the good person you claim to be.

replies.name: Upton Sinclair
replies.comment: How about the conditions in which your workers are working in? I‚Äôm sure they don‚Äôt agree with this‚Ä¶

replies.name: Jacob Riis
replies.comment: This is how your workers are living... Are you really allowing this to happen??

replies.name: Jacob Riis
replies.comment: This is how you are living..

replies.name: Ida Tarbell
replies.comment: Just dropped a book exposing this idiot... Check it out: History of the Standard Oil Company

comments.name: Andrew Carnegie
comments.comment: Just founded my first company - Carnegie Steel Company. Text me when I'm a billionare. No one can stop us now

replies.name: Amalgamated Association of Iron and Steel Workers Union
New York Times
replies.comment: What do you mean by us? You get richer while the poor get poorer.
Already took 1 billionare down... You wanna be next?
replies.name: Sherman Antitrust Act of 1890

comments.name: Andrew Carnegie
comments.comment: Y'all claim that I'm a bad guy... Look at the things that I've done for the world. I've donated to libraries, institutions, so many things to help the poor. I truly believe in that age old adage 'Give a man a fish, feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish, feed him for life.' I've taken that to heart, donating to dozens of institutions and libraries to promote education into the world. I've done so much for the world, and yet I'm still seen as a bad guy. I don't understand it.

replies.name: Jacob Riis
replies.comment: We see what you're saying, but you have to understand that the way you made your money was not the best. You paid your workers very little, and you were very anti-union. You may have done some good things, but you have to understand why people see you as a bad guy. The sheer fact that your workers are living in unsanitary tenements with multiple families in one apartment should speak volumes

comments.name: JP Morgan
comments.comment: Carnegie took over the steel industry, Rockefeller took over the oil indstury. I want in on some action - Maybe I take over the railroads? ü§î

comments.name: Andrew Carnegie

replies.name: Upton Sinclair
replies.comment: You claim to want to help your workers and help them 'get rich'. But with your unsafe working conditions, your workers are fighting to stay alive, forget about becoming rich like you. Take a look at this - The average worker works 10-12 hours a day, making low wages that barely allowed them to survive. If you really wanted to help your workers, you would pay them part of the profits that they helped you make. But you don't. You keep all the profits for yourself. You're a hypocrite.

comments.comment: Those of you that are complaining about being poor, that's on you. Take it from someone that was in your shoes at one point in time. I was poor, but I worked hard and made something of myself. I didn't sit around and complain about how poor I was. I worked hard and made something of myself. You can do the same. Stop complaining and do something about it. Being poor is a choice... Choose to be rich.
